    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CcddInformationTreeHandler, CcddTableTreeHandler

    public class CcddCommonTreeHandler
extends javax.swing.JTree
    CFS Command and Data Dictionary common tree handler class

        Get the total number of nodes that descend from the specified node
        Parameters:
        node - target node
        Returns:
        Total number of nodes that descend from the specified node. The node itself is counted, so the minimum return value is 1

        protected void setExpansionState(java.lang.String expState)
        Restore the tree expansion state
        Parameters:

      • adjustExpansionState

        protected java.lang.String adjustExpansionState(java.lang.String expState,
                                                boolean isByGroup,
                                                boolean isByGroupChanged,
                                                boolean isByType,
                                                boolean isByTypeChanged,
                                                boolean isApp,
                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> topNodePrefixes,
                                                CcddGroupHandler groupHandler,
                                                CcddTableTypeHandler tableTypeHandler)
        Adjust the tree expansion state to account for the tree filter selection status
        Parameters:
        expState - string representing the desired tree expansion state
        isByGroup - true if the tree is filtered by group/application
        isByGroupChanged - true if the group filter status changed
        isByType - true if the tree is filtered by table type
        isByTypeChanged - true if the table type filter status changed
        isApp - true if the groups are to be treated as possible applications; false if the application distinction doesn't apply
        topNodePrefixes - initial portion of the node path that provide the overall division of the tree
        groupHandler - reference to the group handler
        tableTypeHandler - reference to the table type handler
        Returns:
        String representing the tree expansion state with adjustments made to account for the change in filter selection status

      • createNameFromPath

        protected java.lang.String createNameFromPath(java.lang.Object[] path,
                                              int startIndex)
        Convert the elements in tree path array to a single, comma-separated string
        Parameters:
        path - tree path array
        startIndex - index of the first array member to include in the output string
        Returns:
        The tree path array as a single string with individual elements separated by commas

      • clearDisabledNodes

        protected void clearDisabledNodes()
        Deselect any nodes that are disabled

      • addChildNodes

        protected void addChildNodes(CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> selectedPaths,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludedPaths,
                             boolean isVariable)
        Recursively add the children of the specified node to the path list. If these are variable paths and the node represents a bit-wise or string variable then add the bit-packed/string members as well
        Parameters:
        node - current child node to check
        selectedPaths - list containing the selected paths
        excludedPaths - list of paths to be excluded from the tree
        isVariable - true if the tree contains variables

      • getHeaderNodeLevel

        protected int getHeaderNodeLevel()
        Get the first applicable node index. Override this method to skip node levels that don't apply (e.g., root or filter nodes)
        Returns:
        First applicable node index

      • getFullVariablePath

        protected java.lang.String getFullVariablePath(java.lang.Object[] path)
        Convert the path array into a single string showing the full variable path in the format rootTable[,dataType1.variable1[,dataType2.variable2[,...]]]. This excludes the database, prototype/instance, group (if filtered by group), and type (if filtered by type) nodes
        Parameters:
        path - array describing the variable's tree path
        Returns:
        Root table name, followed by the variable names with the data types, separated by commas, from the specified tree path

      • getFullVariablePath

        protected java.lang.String getFullVariablePath(java.lang.Object[] path,
                                               int levelAdjust)
        Convert the path array into a single string showing the full variable path in the format rootTable[,dataType1.variable1[,dataType2.variable2[,...]]]. This excludes the database, prototype/instance, group (if filtered by group), and type (if filtered by type) nodes
        Parameters:
        path - array describing the variable's tree path
        levelAdjust - number of nodes (+/-) by which to adjust the starting the node level
        Returns:
        Root table name, followed by the variable names with the data types, separated by commas, from the specified tree path

      • getBitPackedVariables

        protected CcddClassesDataTable.BitPackNodeIndex getBitPackedVariables(CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node)
        Determine the node indices in the table tree that encompass a group of bit-packed variables
        Parameters:
        node - selected node for a (potentially) bit-packed variable
        Returns:
        NodeIndex object containing the node indices bounding the bit-packed variables

      • getStringVariableMembers

        protected CcddClassesDataTable.BitPackNodeIndex getStringVariableMembers(CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node)
        Determine the node indices in the table tree that encompass the array members that represent the individual bytes of a string variable
        Parameters:
        node - selected node for a (potentially) bit-packed variable
        Returns:
        NodeIndex object containing the node indices bounding the string variable

      • setVariableNodeIcon

        protected void setVariableNodeIcon(javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeCellRenderer renderer,
                                   CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node,
                                   int currentRow,
                                   boolean isLinked)
        Set the tree icon for nodes representing a variable. The icon indicates if the variable is or isn't bit-wise, is or isn't linked, and is or isn't bit-packed
        Parameters:
        renderer - reference to the tree's cell renderer
        node - node for which the icon is to be set
        currentRow - row index of the node in the tree
        isLinked - true if the variable is a member of a link
